intro: Dicliptera obtusifolia var. ciliifera, commonly known as the silky dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves with a soft, silky texture along the edges, which gives it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. This species is often found in moist, disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some African countries.
